justification: “Discriminability (denoted as d'), which quantifies the mean distance between the old and new memory distributions,” shows that the construct is operationalized with the d′ parameter.
The article states that recognition depends on the “decision criterion (denoted as γ),” indicating γ is the quantitative measure of the decision criterion construct.
“In eyewitness research, witnesses' confidence ratings are often used as a proxy for decision criteria,” linking confidence ratings to measurement of the decision criterion.
The text notes that researchers “visualize such trade-offs using receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curves,” identifying ROC curves as the measure for this construct.
construct: Trade-off between true and false positive rates
